alert.note: Alert for Habersham; Rabun (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 03 at 6:27PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Georgia, western North Carolina and upstate South Carolina, including the following areas, in northeast Georgia, Habersham and Rabun. In western North Carolina, Graham, Haywood, Macon, Northern Jackson, Southern Jackson, Swain and Transylvania. In upstate South Carolina, Oconee Mountains and Pickens Mountains. * WHEN...Through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional rainfall of 2 to 3 inches is expected across the watch area through tonight leading to localized storm total amounts up to 6 inches. This could cause scattered flooding of roads, bridges, streams and creeks, leading to larger rivers flooding by Friday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. Please monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
